Text:
An old fortress, the headquarters of the Shadow
Garden. There, recruits endure harsh training
under Lambda's strict gaze.

A young woman who only just joined the Garden, given
the name Number 666, is one such traineeâ€”
Haaahhh!!!
...Pathetic. Hmph!
Ugh! *huff, huff*

I'm here training you myself, and this is the best
you can do? You lack both skill and passion.
Do you even want to be here?
Yes! I do!

Then focus! You think you can beat me with your mind
on everything but your swordplay?!

Well you can't! I won't waste my time on someone who
can't even keep her attention on her own training!
I'm sorry! Please, just give me a little longer!

...No, we're through. There's no merit or sense in
me ninstructing you as you are now.
But...!

What's the point if nothing changes? I know I don't
have any breath to waste on soldiers who don't
show a shred of promise!

If you understand, then go run laps. At least that
should do you some good.
...Understood.

Choking down her frustration and shame, Number 666
sets down her weapon and goes to run as ordered.
*huff, huff*
(What am I doing? This isn't what I came here for...)

(No, this is all because of how pathetic I am. I'm
weak, and that's no one's fault but my own...)
(On the day I made my decision, I was still...)

Perhaps I'll return to the capital, meet with the
factions opposed to Perv...
You have two choices.
Huh?!
Ch-Choices...?

You can fight alone...or you can fight alongside us,
the Shadow Garden. But you have to choose.
Can you...save the Kingdom of Oriana?

Right now, we have no reason to act on your behalf.
If you want to save your country, show us your worth.
Worth...?
Yours, and that of the Kingdom of Oriana.
...Can you truly save my kingdom?
That depends upon you.

...Is Slayerâ€”no, Shadowâ€”the leader of your
organization?
...He is.
...Forgive me, Father.
...Then my blade is yours.

(...That's right. I came here because I was set on
saving Oriana.)

(And yet, nothing is going as I'd hoped... I'm losing
time while gaining nothing in return.)
(If this continues, then Oriana is doomed...)

Number 666 is suddenly overcome by a powerful wave
of uncertainty and panic.

(I can't keep going on like this. I have to do
something...)

(But...what exactly is it that I'm supposed to do?
I know I need to get stronger...)

(But how can I do that when I'm not even sure where
to start...? I'm at a complete loss.)

Beset by confusion and worry, all Number 666 can do
is run until the sun sets, the answers still eluding her.
